thread.title: Best fan reactions to the San Antonio Spurs preseason opener on social media
thread.title_full: Best fan reactions to the San Antonio Spurs preseason opener on social media - San Antonio Express-News

author: Madalyn Mendoza
title: Best fan reactions to the San Antonio Spurs preseason opener on social media
text:
Photo: Mendoza, Madalyn S, Twitter.com/Instagram.com Image 1 of / 13 13 After months of not seeing the Silver and Black in action, Spurs fans couldn't wait for tip off time.
"Preseason tipoff tonight at 10PM ET Get ready," @SA_Spurs_Nation.
Photo: Mendoza, Madalyn S, Twitter.com/Instagram.com After months of not seeing the Silver and Black in action, Spurs... Image 2 of 13 "It's gameday," @spurslove_ posted, something the squad's legion of fans had been waiting to say for months.
Photo: Mendoza, Madalyn S, Twitter.com/Instagram.com "It's gameday," @spurslove_ posted, something the squad's legion of... Image 3 of 13 But there was frustration. Not everyone was able to witness the highly-anticipated event.
"When you can't watch the @spurs game because you don't have NBA League Pass," @katiebelltx
Photo: Mendoza, Madalyn S, Twitter.com/Instagram.com But there was frustration. Not everyone was able to witness the... Image 4 of 13 So they improvised.

Photo: Mendoza, Madalyn S, Twitter.com/Instagram.com So they improvised.
"#GoSpursGo #SpursNation @spurs," @Alemonster93. Image 5 of 13 LaMarcus Aldridge got his first taste of the Pop treatment.

Photo: Mendoza, Madalyn S, Twitter.com/Instagram.com LaMarcus Aldridge got his first taste of the Pop... Image 6 of 13 But once he was cleared, excitement of seeing Aldridge on the court, in a Spurs jersey followed.
"The start of a new era in San Antonio. Welcome, @aldridge_12," @jonathan_dlf2."

Especially from @mikee4reel who fearlessly showed his love from the sidelines.

@CoryOnJuice was left with no words, just sad emojis.

@CoryOnJuice was left... Image 10 of 13 But Spurs diehards will always find the positive.

"The struggle is real," @GoSpursGoMemes.
Photo: Mendoza, Madalyn S, Twitter.com/Instagram.com Spurs fans haven't felt the next day blues since late... Image 12 of 13 They don't seem to be too worried.

Photo: Mendoza, Madalyn S, Twitter.com/Instagram.com They don't seem to be too worried.
"Had to do a little math this... Image 13 of 13 Best fan reactions to the San Antonio Spurs preseason opener on social media 1 / 13 Back to Gallery Silver and Black jerseys returned to the hardwood Thursday as the Spurs took on the Sacramento Kings — a welcomed sight for sore, basketball-deprived eyes in San Antonio.
But, not all were able to witness the first time new players like LaMarcus Aldridge and George West competed as Spurs due to the game not being televised on local channels. The disappointment continued throughout the night as San Antonio’s team fell 3 points short to the Kings, who were 29-53 last season, in a 92-95 loss.
RELATED: Spurs fall in Aldridge’s debut
Aldridge, poised to be a force to be reckon with in the team’s rebuild, managed 8 points and 3 rebounds in his 23 minutes of play.
Jimmer Mania will run wild on you!
 #GoSpursGo #Spurs #SpursNation #RaceForSeis #SpursFamily pic.twitter.com/lSrp0RP3LO
— GO SPURS GO MEMES (@GoSpursGoMemes) October 9, 2015 Despite the loss, the small amount of Spurs fans who were able to watch the game were not discouraged, considering the squad was lacking the Big Three, Coach Popovich and ample time for the revamped roster to gel.
They aired their reactions online, from pregame excitement to coping with sleep deprivation caused by Spurs the morning after.
Click through the gallery above to see reactions to the Spurs’ first time on the court this season.
memndoza@mysa.com
